verses.roman:
atha nārāyaṇaḥ devaḥ
taṁ dṛṣṭvā vyasṛjaj jvaram
māheśvaro vaiṣṇavaś ca
yuyudhāte jvarāv ubhau

synonyms: atha—thereupon; nārāyaṇaḥ devaḥ—Lord Nārāyaṇa (Kṛṣṇa); tam—him (the Śiva-jvara); dṛṣṭvā—seeing; vyasṛjat—released; jvaram—His personified fever (of extreme cold, as opposed to the extreme heat of the Śiva-jvara); māheśvaraḥ—of Lord Māheśvara; vaiṣṇavaḥ—of Lord Viṣṇu; ca—and; yuyudhāte—fought; jvarau—the two fevers; ubhau—against each other.
translation: Seeing this personified weapon approach, Lord Nārāyaṇa then released His own personified fever weapon, the Viṣṇu-jvara. The Śiva-jvara and Viṣṇu-jvara thus battled each other.
